title: The Lazarus Strain
premise: A brilliant but disgraced virologist, Dr. Aris Thorne, is offered a chance at redemption by a secretive biotech firm to develop a revolutionary resurrection therapy. When the first human trial subject awakens, he doesn't just remember his past life—he remembers being murdered by the company's billionaire founder. Now, Aris must expose the truth while a genetically-engineered pathogen, designed to rewrite mortality itself, threatens to escape the lab.
protagonist: Dr. Aris Thorne, a virologist haunted by a past patient's death and battling a hidden addiction.
conflict: Thorne must stop his employers from unleashing a world-altering bioweapon born from their founder's dark secret, while evading a corporate kill squad and containing a pathogen that could redefine life and death.
setting: Present-day, at the isolated and hyper-secure 'Prometheus Station' research facility built into a remote Alaskan mountainside.
tone: Claustrophobic, paranoid, and intellectually chilling, blending cutting-edge science with a race against a contagion of conscience.
